label: 北条重時
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Hōjō Shigetoki (J.) 北条重時, also called 極楽寺殿 Gokurakuji dono, with the clerical name of 観覚 Kangaku. This powerful member of the Kamakura shogunate was the son of Hōjō Yoshitoki (1163-1224) and chief aide of his older brother, the shogunal regent Yasutoki (1183-1242). He became a monk in 1256, and died at the age of 63 in 1261.
